docs.lead_paragraph: Test-tube research shows that gossypol, a cottonseed oil extract used as an experimental male contraceptive in China, apparently kills the genital herpes virus and the microbe that causes gonorrhea, experts in biomedical research said yesterday. Studies showing this and leading to two clinical trials of gossypol against genital herpes in humans were conducted by scientists at the University of Helsinki in Finland.
docs.snippet: Test-tube research shows that gossypol, a cottonseed oil extract used as an experimental male contraceptive in China, apparently kills the genital herpes virus and the microbe that causes gonorrhea, experts in biomedical research said yesterday.  ...

docs.lead_paragraph: An innovative program to curb the soaring cost of health care by offering hospitals financial incentives to cut their budgets goes into effect in Massachusetts tomorrow, the first plan of its kind in the country. Doctors, health care administrators and businessmen in the state are deeply divided over the new law, which may save up to $1 billion in state hospital costs over the next six years. David Rosenbloom, Commissioner of Health and Hospitals in Boston, applauded the law, saying it will give hospitals an opportunity ''to find creative ways to take care of more people for a little bit less money by giving the hospitals the money and letting them figure out how to spend it.'' Richard Rogan, a spokesman for Massachusetts Blue Cross, suggested that ''hospitals will now have to be run like a business.'' But Dr. Mitchell T. Rabkin, president of Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, said he feared that the law would force hospitals to reduce patient care by taking measures like laying off medical personnel, cutting back clinic hours and requiring patients to wait in line for drugs.
docs.snippet: An innovative program to curb the soaring cost of health care by offering hospitals financial incentives to cut their budgets goes into effect in Massachusetts tomorrow, the first plan of its kind in the country.   Doctors, health care administrators...
